# Stakeholder Communication Plan Template

Use this template to plan, schedule, and track communications with project stakeholders. Owned by the **Stakeholder Liaison**; reviewed by the Project Manager at initiation and updated each phase.

---

## Project Information

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| Project Name | _Project Name_ |
| Project Manager | _Name_ |
| Stakeholder Liaison | _Name_ |
| Version | 1.0 |
| Last Updated | YYYY-MM-DD |

---

## Stakeholder Registry

| ID | Name / Group | Role | Interest / Need | Influence | Preferred Channel | Preferred Frequency |
|----|--------------|------|-----------------|-----------|-------------------|---------------------|
| S-001 | _Executive Sponsor_ | Approver | Budget approval, strategic alignment | High | Email summary | Monthly |
| S-002 | _External Partner_ | Collaborator | API integration milestones | Med | Meeting + email | Bi-weekly |
| S-003 | _Support Team_ | Informed | Feature changes, known issues | Low | Release notes | Per release |

> **Influence**: High / Med / Low based on their ability to affect project decisions or outcomes.

---

## Communication Matrix

| Audience | Message / Content | Owner | Channel | Frequency | Timing | Format |
|----------|-------------------|-------|---------|-----------|--------|--------|
| Executive Sponsor | Status, risks, decisions needed | Project Manager | Email | Monthly | First week of month | 1-page summary |
| All Stakeholders | Milestone updates | Stakeholder Liaison | Email / Confluence | Per milestone | Within 2 days of milestone | Announcement + linked doc |
| External Partners | Integration progress, blockers | Stakeholder Liaison | Meeting + email | Bi-weekly | Mondays | Meeting notes + action items |
| Delivery Team | Daily progress, blockers | Project Manager | Standup / Slack | Daily | Morning | Verbal + async update |
| Support / Ops | Upcoming changes, release notes | Change Control Coordinator | Email | Per release | 3 days before release | Release notes |

---

## Communication Cadence by Phase

### Initiation
- [ ] Stakeholder kickoff meeting scheduled and invites sent
- [ ] Stakeholder registry populated
- [ ] Communication plan reviewed and approved by Project Manager

### Planning
- [ ] Detailed milestone schedule shared with all stakeholders
- [ ] Communication channels confirmed with each stakeholder group

### Execution
- [ ] Bi-weekly (or agreed frequency) status updates sent
- [ ] Risks and blockers escalated to relevant stakeholders within 24 hours of identification
- [ ] Feedback from stakeholders logged and triaged

### Release
- [ ] Release announcement drafted and reviewed by Stakeholder Liaison and PM
- [ ] External partners notified per agreed lead time
- [ ] Release notes distributed to Support/Ops team

### Retrospective
- [ ] Key learnings and outcomes shared with stakeholders as appropriate
- [ ] Communication plan archived with project documentation

---

## Escalation Path

1. Issue identified → Stakeholder Liaison documents and notifies Project Manager
2. Project Manager assesses severity and decides on stakeholder escalation
3. High-severity issues escalated to Executive Sponsor within 24 hours
4. All escalations logged in the [Risk Register](risk-register-template.md) and [Change Log](change-log-template.md)

---

- **Project Manager** — reviews and co-owns escalation decisions
- **Change Control Coordinator** — notifies stakeholders of approved changes
